title: Building work pending for many of 40 promised hospitals
description: Only two are finished and open, with 33 planned for England yet to have any building work done, the BBC has found.

title: Slurping Spaghetti and other food photo contest winners
description: An image called the Candy Man by UK photographer Jon Enoch wins the overall prize.

title: Number struggling to pay bills soars by 40%, FCA finds
description: The UK's financial regulator says 10.9 million adults are struggling to pay debts and bills.

title: Treat cryptocurrency investing as gambling, MPs say
description: Retail investment in cryptocurrency is too risky to be regulated as a financial service, a committee says.

title: No-fault evictions to be banned in reform of rental sector
description: The government is introducing a new law designed to overhaul the rental sector in England.

title: Why Somalia's once-banned boxing thrives in the former warzone
description: Somalia's only official boxing club offers a haven for a group of young people in Mogadishu.

title: Why Bud Light and Disney are under attack from conservatives
description: Conservatives say their fights against "woke" corporations are paying off.

title: Bus £2 fare cap extended to end of October
description: The decision is the second time the government has extended the cap for bus operators in England.

title: Luton Town 2-0 Sunderland (Agg 3-2): Hatters power through to play-off final
description: Luton Town are one win away from a return to the top flight of English football after overturning a first-leg deficit to beat Sunderland 3-2 on aggregate.

title: Inter Milan 1-0 AC Milan (3-0 agg): Inter reach Champions League final for first time in 13 years
description: Inter Milan reach the Champions League final as Lautaro Martinez's goal seals a 3-0 aggregate victory over derby rivals AC Milan.

title: Vauxhall-maker says UK needs to change its Brexit deal
description: Vauxhall-maker Stellantis is calling on the government to renegotiate some Brexit rules or risk losing UK operations.

title: Biden G7: President to cut short foreign trip for debt ceiling talks
description: Joe Biden will head home after a G7 meeting in Japan for talks with congressional leaders in the US.

title: Zak Crawley: England opener 'doesn't care' about online criticism of Test selection
description: Zak Crawley says he "doesn't care" about online criticism over his selection in England's Test team to face Ireland.

title: Man Utd sale: Qatari banker Sheikh Jassim makes improved offer to buy club
description: Qatari banker Sheikh Jassim bin Hamad Al Thani makes an improved offer to buy Manchester United.

title: Sam Altman: CEO of OpenAI calls for US to regulate artificial intelligence
description: Sam Altman says government regulation is "critical" to control the risks of artificial intelligence.

title: Tory donor case reignites debate on access and influence
description: The system is back in question after party donor Javad Marandi loses his fight to stay anonymous.

title: Marathon one of the best days of my life - Rob Burrow
description: The event has raised more than £825,000 for Leeds Hospitals Charity.

title: Two poultry workers test positive for bird flu
description: The cases in England were found during screening and there is no sign of human-to-human transmission.

title: Rapper Slowthai appears in court after rape charge
description: The 28-year-old rapper from Northampton is expected to appear before Oxford Crown Court next month.

title: Asante King asks British Museum to return gold to Ghana
description: Asante King met with the British Museum's director on a recent visit to London.

title: Giro d'Italia: Magnus Cort wins stage 10 as Geraint Thomas retains overall lead
description: Magnus Cort claims his maiden Giro d'Italia stage victory as Britain's Geraint Thomas maintains a two-second overall lead.

title: Kate tells pupils she ‘never expected to be royal but fell in love’
description: The Princess of Wales is meeting students in Bath supported by the Dame Kelly Holmes Trust.

title: School-absence fines make problem worse, MPs told
description: Penalties put more pressure on already struggling families, charity leaders tell a government inquiry.

title: Greggs wins right to late-night Leicester Square trading
description: The bakery has been fighting for permission to open its Leicester Square store around the clock.

title: Brigitte Macron's great-nephew beaten in apparently politically motivated assault
description: Eight people have been arrested over the attack which came after a TV address by President Macron on Monday.

title: French Resistance man breaks silence over German prisoners executed in 1944
description: Edmond Réveil, 98, said he wanted them to be remembered and their families to know where they are.

title: Folarin Balogun: Fifa accepts Arsenal forward's switch to USA from England
description: Fifa has accepted Arsenal forward Folarin Balogun's decision to switch international allegiance from England to the United States.

title: Jofra Archer: Why the latest injury to England's 'generational talent' is the 'cruellest of blows'
description: BBC chief cricket writer Stephan Shemilt assesses why Jofra Archer's latest elbow injury is the cruellest of blows for a generational talent.

title: US PGA Championship: Rory McIlroy says Masters cut was 'wake-up call' for majors ahead
description: Rory McIlroy says he "needs to have more acceptance" of his game as he prepares for this week's US PGA Championship at Oak Hill.

title: University of Oxford drops Sackler name from buildings
description: It is the latest UK institution to cut ties to the family over their links to the US opioid crisis.

title: Julian Knight: Police to investigate MP accused of sexual assault
description: Scotland Yard refer an allegation of serious sexual assault by Julian Knight to Essex Police.

title: Bank of England economist sorry for 'accept you're poorer' remark
description: Huw Pill says he regrets saying people should get used to being poorer or risk high inflation.

title: Italian Open 2023 results: Iga Swiatek beats Donna Vekic in Rome

title: Champions League: Man City boss Pep Guardiola on his 'exceptional legacy'
description: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola says his "legacy is exceptional already" as he prepares for Wednesday's Champions League semi-final second leg against Real Madrid.

title: Watch: Shark comes out of nowhere and rams man's kayak
description: Angler Scott Haraguchi filmed the dramatic moment and was not hurt during the encounter in Hawaii.

title: Nurses strike because patients are dying - RCN union boss Pat Cullen
description: Union boss says issues over safe staffing is part of the ongoing debate with government, as well as fair pay.

title: Facebook and Instagram paid verification starts in UK

title: BBC journalists in England to strike over local radio cuts
description: National Union of Journalists members will stage a 48-hour strike after rejecting revised plans.

title: Police get 200 tip-offs for 22 unidentified murdered women
description: Detectives are following potential leads after launching a campaign to identify 22 victims in Europe.

description: A man has been arrested after Katie Higton, 27, and Steven Harnett, 25, were killed in Huddersfield.

title: Privacy breaches at Mirror Group Newspapers covered up, court told
description: Prince Harry is among high-profile figures accusing Mirror Group Newspapers of unlawful practices.

title: Champions League: Man City's Kyle Walker on hug with Vinicius Jr

description: "Intimidating" Jacob Allerson is banned from making sexual comments in public to any woman in England.

title: Rebekah Vardy says she was abused during Jehovah's Witness childhood

title: Teachers and nurses dragged into higher taxes, warns think tank

title: Fraudsters sold passports to criminals on the run

title: Children in England ranked fourth globally for reading
description: Some countries were not included in the main rankings table after delaying testing due to the Covid pandemic.

title: Djokovic knocks Norrie out of Italian Open
description: Defending champion Novak Djokovic reaches his 17th Italian Open quarter-final with a tense victory over British number one Cameron Norrie.

title: Do not resuscitate: Man choked to death after paramedics stood down
description: A care home resident, 80, died after an ambulance was stood down due to a do not resuscitate order.

description: The Forrest Gump star says technology could be used to recreate his image in movies after his death.

title: Manager and player behaviour towards referees 'not good enough', says Howard Webb
description: The behaviour of managers and players towards match officials "has not been good enough" this season, says referees' chief Howard Webb.

title: Francis Ngannou: Former UFC champion signs PFL contract
description: Former UFC heavyweight champion Francis Ngannou signs a deal with the Professional Fighters League.

title: Martha Stewart, 81, becomes oldest Sports Illustrated swimsuit cover star
description: The businesswoman says she wants to inspire other women, adding: "This is kind of historic."

title: Sats: Schools minister says tests shouldn't be too hard
description: Parents and teachers say last week's Year 6 reading paper was so difficult it left children in tears.

title: VAR: Listen to how referees make decisions
description: Listen to the in-game audio between the match officials as referee Chris Kavanagh awards Newcastle a penalty for handball against Arsenal, before the decision is overturned.

title: The Ashes 2023: Jofra Archer ruled out for summer as England recall Jonny Bairstow
description: England recall Jonny Bairstow in place of Ben Foakes for Ireland Test, but fast bowler Jofra Archer is ruled out for the summer.

title: Dirty-bomb antidote: Drug trial begins in US
description: Volunteers will test a pill designed to remove radioactive contamination from the body.

title: After breast cancer diagnosis and 15 rounds of chemo, cox Kennedy returns
description: Britain's Erin Kennedy will cox at the European Rowing Championships exactly one year after her breast cancer diagnosis.

title: Dresden jewel theft: Five men convicted of audacious 2019 heist
description: In 2019 the gang broke into a museum in Dresden and stole treasures worth €113 million (£98m).

title: Greggs bakery sales up nearly a fifth in past year
description: The bakery chain said hot food like chicken goujons, wedges and pizza were particularly popular.

title: Watch scientists' joy as rare platypus is released back into the wild

title: Netball World Cup 2023: England Roses name squad for South Africa tournament
description: England netball head coach Jess Thirlby names Chelsea Pitman in her 12-player squad for July's World Cup in South Africa.

title: Vodafone to cut 11,000 jobs as new boss says firm 'not good enough'
description: New chief Margherita Della Valle says the mobile firm's performance "has not been good enough".

title: Record numbers not working due to ill health

title: Watch: News crew rescue dog stuck in tornado rubble

title: Ros Atkins on... Seven problems facing Russia in Ukraine

title: Scratby beach walker finds crisp packet from 1960s

description: Elena Gordon's son Vladimir Kara-Murza was convicted of treason for criticising Putin's war in Ukraine.

title: Ukraine war: Kyiv comes under missile attack
description: In video circulating on social media, air defence systems can be seen shooting down missiles.

title: Rudy Giuliani accused of sexual harassment by ex-employee
description: Donald Trump's former lawyer is accused of coercing an ex-employee into sex in a $10m civil case.

title: 'I've been stuck in my bedroom for two years'
description: A young woman with a rare disease says she is not being supported to have any quality of life.

title: Online depression therapy given go-ahead in England
description: Psychiatrists and mental health charities say digital therapies are no substitute for one-to-one care.

title: Surf champion Lucy Campbell says her sport must be greener
description: Seven times British women's champion Lucy Campbell is calling for more environmentally friendly surfboards and wetsuits.

title: Nigeria election: The mystery of the altered results in disputed poll
description: A BBC investigation has found significant discrepancies in the election results in one region of the country.
